stem: The nurse is administering anticoagulants. Match each medication with its specific pharmacological class.

rationale.correct: Accurate classification is required for monitoring and reversal planning. (r1 & r4) The '-xaban' drugs inhibit Factor Xa directly. (r2) Dabigatran acts directly on thrombin. (r3) Enoxaparin is the gold standard injectable LMWH.
rationale.incorrect: LMWH is always injectable; Factor Xa inhibitors like apixaban are oral.
clinicalPearls: Enoxaparin should be administered in the 'love handles' (lateral abdomen) and the injection site should not be massaged.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember that the 'xa' in the name (apiXAban, rivaroXAban) tells you it works on Factor Xa!

reviewUnits.heading: Anticoagulation Pharmacotherapy
reviewUnits.body: Nurses monitor for common side effects (bleeding, bruising) and educate on fall safety. DOACs are preferred over warfarin for most atrial fibrillation and DVT treatments.
